dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Distribution
dataObjects.title: Range Description
dataObjects.rights: © International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources
dataObjects.rightsHolder: International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources
dataObjects.bibliographicCitation: Chaudhry, S. 2010. Channa amphibeus. In: IUCN 2014 . IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Version 2014.1 . <www.iucnredlist.org>
dataObjects.description: Channa amphibeus is known from the type locality in India (Chel River, Assam and northern Bengal). The species has been reported from the Brahmaputra River by local people (S.C. Dey pers. comm. 2010). It is also reported from Bhutan (Eschmeyer and Fricke 2010; Froese and Pauly 2010), but identifications require confirmation, as the species has been confused in the past with C. barca.

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Distribution
dataObjects.description: Southern Asia: native to northeastern India and Bhutan.

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Distribution

Habitat and Ecology
Very limited information available; it is a hill stream species.

Systems
  • Freshwater

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Conservation
dataObjects.title: IUCN Red List Assessment
dataObjects.rights: © International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources
dataObjects.rightsHolder: International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources
dataObjects.bibliographicCitation: Chaudhry, S. 2010. Channa amphibeus. In: IUCN 2014 . IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Version 2014.1 . <www.iucnredlist.org>
dataObjects.description:
Red List Category
LC
Least Concern

Red List Criteria

Version
3.1

Year Assessed
2010

Assessor/s
Chaudhry, S.

Reviewer/s
Jha, B.R., Datta, N.C., Britz, R., Dey, S.C., Vishwanath, W. & Allen, D.J.

Contributor/s
Molur, S.

Justification
Channa amphibeus is known from the type locality (Chel River, India) and from the Brahmaputra, and may also be present in Bhutan. It is assessed currently assessed as Least Concern, however further research is required on the species distribution and threats, and the records from Bhutan require confirmation.

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Trends
dataObjects.title: Population
dataObjects.rights: © International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources
dataObjects.rightsHolder: International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources
dataObjects.bibliographicCitation: Chaudhry, S. 2010. Channa amphibeus. In: IUCN 2014 . IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Version 2014.1 . <www.iucnredlist.org>
dataObjects.description:
Population
There is very limited information for this species as it has been confused with C. barca in the literature (Reddy 1981) and hence its interest to fisheries is not clearly known. Reported to be fairly common in northern Bengal .

Population Trend
Unknown
